intro: Yucca gloriosa var. recurvata, commonly known as the curly leaf yucca, is a striking plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its rosette of long, narrow, blue-gray leaves that curve backward, giving it a unique and dramatic appearance. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing white or pale yellow flowers in the spring. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid or semi-arid climates. Its hardy nature and ornamental value make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
